title: Naomi Sharon Shows Off Her Ethereal Vocals With Tender ‘Definition of Love’ Live Performance
summary: The OVO Sound singer's Live From Paradiso EP arrives on Dec. 24.
body: Naomi Sharon is dropping off an early Christmas gift for fans, as the OVO Sound singer’s Live From Paradiso EP is slated to be released on Wednesday (Dec. 24). Ahead of the live album’s arrival, Sharon shares an early taste of the project with Billboard , showcasing her ethereal vocals with a live performance of “Definition of Love,” which originally served as the opener from the Dutch-Caribbean singer’s Obsidian album. The footage is pulled from Sharon’s Netherlands stop at the famed Paradiso venue on her The Only Love We Know Tour, which took the singer global and featured shows across the U.S. and Europe throughout 2025. Rocking a dove-white bodysuit, Sharon effortlessly bares her soul, drenched in the warmth of “Definition of Love.” “This live EP captures the final night of the European tour and the closing chapter of the Obsidian and The Only Love We Know era,” Sharon tells Billboard . “Ending this journey in the Netherlands, at Paradiso, felt like the most meaningful way to bring it home.” The rest of the live project will feature Sharon’s velvety vocals across seven tracks from her sold-out 2025 g…

title: Travis Kelce Wrote Taylor Swift a Romantic Letter Before Eras Tour End: ‘Beginning of Me Meeting the Love of My Life’
summary: The pop superstar reads the message her fiancé sent to her during the final episodes of her docuseries.
body: Travis Kelce is a poet — but certainly not a tortured one. During the final episodes of The End of an Era , Taylor Swift received a letter the NFL tight end wrote his now fiancée before her tour came to a close in December of 2024. Related Taylor Swift’s ‘The End of an Era’ Calls This LP the ‘Biggest Album of Her Career to Date’ Taylor Swift’s ‘The End of an Era’: 13 Things We’ve Learned From the Docuseries So Far Taylor Swift Finally Reveals Who in Her Life Was ‘Playing Cupid’ to Get Her & Travis Kelce Together “So many unbelievable memories on this tour, but my favorite one is seeing you in concert for the first time. Being mesmerized and swept off my feet by a woman who doesn’t even know me. I selfishly say thank you for creating this legendary tour and to Robert [Allen, her tour manager] for making you stop through Kansas City, Mo. That night two in KC was the beginning of me meeting the love of my life,” Taylor read, before sweetly exclaiming, “Ohhhh my god!” Kelce famously attended her Eras show on July 8, 2023, at Arrowhead Stadium, where he plays football for the Chiefs. Later that m…

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘The End of an Era’ Calls This LP the ‘Biggest Album of Her Career to Date’
summary: Swift’s docuseries closes out with what happened after the tour finished -- and poses a challenge for her future works.
body: As the the final episode of Taylor Swift ’s The End of an Era comes to a close, title cards explaining what happened after The Eras Tour flash on the screen — including how she bought her masters , announced the news of her engagement to Travis Kelce and released The Life of a Showgirl . “On Oct. 3, 2025, Taylor released her 12th studio album, The Life of a Showgirl . The biggest album of her career,” the postscript read, before adding “to date.” Related Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ Hits Double-Digit Weeks at No. 1 on Billboard 200 Taylor Swift’s ‘The End of an Era’: 13 Things We’ve Learned From the Docuseries So Far Taylor Swift Finally Reveals Who in Her Life Was ‘Playing Cupid’ to Get Her & Travis Kelce Together That sounds like a promise to Swifties. Of course, The Life of a Showgirl — currently No. 1 on the Billboard 200 , having spent 10 non-consecutive weeks at the top — broke the modern day record for equivalent album units earned in its first week with 4.002 million (outselling Adele’s 25 , the record’s previous holder), and ended 2025 as the biggest album of the year on that chart. Its le…

title: Paul McCartney Got Back to the Top of the Touring Chart With $51 Million-Plus Gross in November
summary: It's his first month at No. 1 since 2022.
body: Earlier in December, Billboard reported on rock’s ongoing decline to an all-time low in 2025, as its long-held dominance is challenged by an increasingly young slate of stadium headliners. But as we approach 2026, the genre is fighting back, returning to the top of the monthly Boxscore report. Related Top 10 Highest Grossing Rock Tours of the Year Metallica’s First Bahrain Concert Was a Teenage Dream Come True for the Venue’s Architect Watch Beyoncé, Shakira, Paul McCartney & More Race to the Top of Year-End Boxscore Charts According to figures reported to Billboard Boxscore, Paul McCartney grossed $51.7 million and sold 150,000 tickets across 11 shows in November, earning the highest grossing tour of the month. It’s his second time at No. 1, after leading in May 2022. Even though McCartney’s last triumph was three and a half years ago, it’s all contributing to the same tour. He launched the Got Back Tour in April of 2022, and has continued with legs in the fall of 2023, 2024 and now 2025. Altogether, the tour has earned $410.7 million and sold 2.4 million tickets. Both of McCartney’s monthly victories were from shows in the United States, but Got Back has…

title: The 2025 Billboard K-Pop Artist 100
summary: Billboard Korea compiled the ranking in partnership with Billboard based on each artist's achievements from October 2024 to September 2025.
body: The Billboard K-Pop Artist 100 is back! The 2025 ranking was compiled by Billboard Korea in partnership with Billboard based on each artist’s achievements from October 2024 to September 2025 on the U.S.-based Billboard Hot 100 songs chart and Billboard 200 albums chart, along with the internationally reflective Billboard Global 200 songs chart, global Billboard Boxscore touring data and streaming and songs sales activity within Korea. Luminate is the streaming and sales source for all of the respective rankings (excluding Billboard Boxscore). Related The 25 Best K-Pop Songs of 2025: Staff Picks The No. 1 spot goes to SEVENTEEN and its 13 members, with consistent performance in the U.S., global and Korean markets. SEVENTEEN’s decade-long career reached new heights this year, cementing its status as one of the most powerful K-pop groups. The act had an exceptionally active year — not only in touring, but also in album releases. Spill the Feels (November 2024) debuted at No. 5 on the Billboard 200, while SEVENTEEN’s most recent album, HAPPY BURSTDAY, debuted at No. 2 on the Billboard 200 in June. Additionally, three of the group’s subunits — BSS, HOSHI X WOOZI and C…

title: From Bad Bunny to Shakira, 5 Defining Moments for Latin Music in 2025
summary: Karol G, Carín León & Maná also made history in the last 12 months.
body: As 2025 comes to an end, Latin music continues its unstoppable march toward billion-dollar-plus revenue for the third consecutive year. This, despite hefty headwinds, including bans on corridos in Mexico and a crackdown on immigrants Stateside that has some worrying about drops in concert attendance. However, none of that seems to have made a dent. According to Luminate’s Mid-Year Music Report published July 18, which measures consumption for the first six months of 2025, Latin’s market sharepoint change was +.25, the second-largest growth of any genre behind only rock and outpacing both country and Christian/gospel. The biggest growth came from regional Mexican music, which has found a new generation of fans thanks to a growing contingent of young acts who appeal to a cross-section of supporters that go beyond the U.S. and Mexico. Related The 25 Best Latin Albums of 2025: Staff Picks Pamela Bustios , Leila Cobo , Ingrid Fajardo , Sigal Ratner-Arias , Isabela Raygoza , Jessica Roiz With that sustained growth, Latin continues to be the fifth most-consumed genre of music in the U.S., its growth outpacing every genre except rock. According to the RIAA’s mid-year report, Latin mu…

title: Lil Baby and Lil Yachty Make Christmas Dreams Come True With Atlanta Holiday Toy Drive For 2,000 Kids
summary: The rappers handed out winter coats, gift cards and toys over the weekend at the event attended by Santa Claus and members of the Atlanta Hawks organization.
body: Christmas came a little early over the weekend when Lil Baby and Lil Yachty hosted a holiday toy drive in Atlanta. The pair teamed up through their respective charities, the Jones Project and the Lil Yachty Foundation, to distribute winter coats, gift cards and toys to more than 2,000 local youth at the event. In an Instagram recap video cued to Lil Baby’s “Middle of the Summer,” a long line of kids and families can be seen cueing up outside a warehouse on Atlanta’s West End to enter the festively decorated space, where members of the Atlanta Hawks cheer team greeted them as they shopped for items including new bicycles, Instamatic cameras, video gaming gear, big screen TVs, laptops, Nerf guns and a variety of toys for little kids. There was also a candy bar with cheery attendants filling plastic bags with all kinds of goodies, a photo op with Santa and a hot chocolate bar. Near the end of the clip, Baby rolls up in his black car and greets some of his fans as he makes his way inside to take selfies and wait in line for his own family photo op with Santa . According to the Atlanta Voice , other items up for offer included gift cards, Canada Goose winter coa…

title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4750-4762: See You on the Other Side of the Sun
summary: Written by Lucy Thompson, Planetary Scientist and APXS team member, University of New Brunswick, Canada Earth planning date: Monday, Dec. 22, 2025 As we all prepare for the holiday season here on Earth, we have been planning a few last activities before Curiosity and the team of scientists and engi…
body: Curiosity Navigation Curiosity Home Mission Overview Where is Curiosity? Mission Updates Science Overview Instruments Highlights Exploration Goals News and Features Multimedia Curiosity Raw Images Images Videos Audio Mosaics More Resources Mars Missions Mars Sample Return Mars Perseverance Rover Mars Curiosity Rover MAVEN Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Mars Odyssey More Mars Missions Mars Home 3 min read Curiosity Blog, Sols 4750-4762: See You on the Other Side of the Sun NASA’s Mars rover Curiosity acquired this image, with the boxwork terrain in the foreground and Gale crater rim in the far background, using its Right Navigation Camera. Curiosity captured the image on Dec. 21, 2025 — Sol 4755, or Martian day 4,755 of the Mars Science Laboratory mission — at 15:57:21 UTC. NASA/JPL-Caltech Written by Lucy Thompson, Planetary Scientist and APXS team member, University of New Brunswick, Canada Earth planning date: Monday, Dec. 22, 2025 As we all prepare for the holiday season here on Earth, we have been planning a few last activities before Curiosity and the team of scientists and engineers take a well-deserved, extended break. This holiday season coincides with conjunction — every two…
